title: Ukraine War Plans Leak Prompts Pentagon Investigation
description: Classified documents detailing secret American and NATO plans have appeared on Twitter and Telegram.

title: U.S. Ambassador Meets with Russian Official on Evan Gershkovich Detention
description: Lynne M. Tracy, the ambassador, spoke with Sergei A. Ryabkov, the Russian deputy foreign minister. U.S. officials have not been granted consular access to Mr. Gershkovich in the past week, a State Department official said.

title: Xi and Macron Call for Ukraine Peace Talks, but the Path Is Murky
description: It is not clear that the Chinese and French leaders — much less Russia and Ukraine — have compatible terms for talks or peace, and Mr. Xi has not publicly agreed to pressure Moscow to negotiate.

title: Your Friday Briefing: U.S. Admits Flaws in Afghanistan Withdrawal
description: Plus China and France call for peace talks between Russia and Ukraine, and India scrubs its textbooks.

title: Marlène Schiappa Posed for Playboy (Clothed). France Is Looking, and Talking.
description: Critics have questioned the junior minister’s choice of publication, and government officials have called the magazine shoot a distraction amid nationwide protests over a new pension law.

title: Zelensky’s Aides Send Mixed Messages on Crimea
description: Top government officials in Kyiv clarify that their mission remains to reclaim all Ukrainian territory from Russia.

title: NATO Countries Are Divided Over Giving Ukraine Membership, Officials Say
description: The debate on the status of Kyiv will continue up to the military alliance’s mid-July summit meeting.

title: Prigozhin, Russia’s Wagner Leader, Says Ukraine Continues to Fight in Bakhmut
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, who leads the mercenary group, also said that Russia would need better organization and more ammunition to push beyond the besieged city.

title: U.S. Acknowledges Afghanistan Evacuations Should Have Started Sooner
description: President Biden’s decision to end a 20-year war in August 2021 led to the swift collapse of the Afghan government and military.

title: Biden Administration to Curb Toxic Pollutants From Chemical Plants
description: The rule would affect the majority of chemical manufacturers, which have plants spread across the Gulf Coast, the Ohio River Valley and in West Virginia.

title: Silvio Berlusconi, Former Italian Prime Minister, Is Being Treated for Leukemia
description: Mr. Berlusconi, who is in the intensive care unit of a Milan hospital, has had the blood disorder for “some time,” his personal physician said.

title: Militias in Lebanon Fire Rocket Barrage Into Israel
description: The unusual attack followed weeks of rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah, an Iran-backed group that is very powerful in Lebanon.

title: Saudi and Iranian Foreign Ministers Meet in China After Thaw
description: The high-level meeting was a sign that the regional rivals are moving ahead with an agreement to re-establish relations, mediated last month by Beijing.

title: Macron Urges Xi to ‘Bring Russia Back to Reason’
description: The leaders of France and China appealed for an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine, but Xi Jinping did not indicate whether he would nudge Vladimir Putin. Here is what we’re covering:

title: French Unions and Government in Deadlock as Pension Protests Resume
description: The council that reviews legislation for constitutional issues is expected to rule on President Emmanuel Macron’s pension overhaul next week.

title: Macron’s meeting with Xi could affect the direction of the war.
The Power and Limits of Abortion Politics
description: What should we make of the role that abortion played in both the Chicago and Wisconsin elections this week?

title: Man Who Kidnapped Platypus Is Charged in Australia
description: The police had appealed for help after the platypus was spotted at a train station in Queensland. The animal was later released, but the authorities have been unable to find it.

title: Indian Textbooks Purged of Material Narendra Modi’s Party Finds Inconvenient
description: The changes removed or shrank references to Hindu extremism, the country’s secular foundation and India’s long Muslim history.

title: Politics Complicates Chinese Reaction to U.S. Visit by Taiwan’s President
description: For Beijing, showing displeasure too openly carries risks, particularly of harming the chances for its preferred party in Taiwan’s coming presidential election.

title: In Pristine Alaska, an Oil Giant Prepares to Drill for Decades
description: Scientists say nations must stop new oil and gas projects to avoid climate catastrophe. But after the Biden administration greenlit the $8 billion Willow project, ConocoPhillips is racing ahead.

title: In Northern Ireland Town, Painful Memories Lie Beneath a Fragile Peace
description: Twenty-five years after the Good Friday Agreement ended an era of bloodshed, this is a moment to celebrate reconciliation across Northern Ireland. But for many, the past is not always easy to leave behind.

title: It’s Not Just Willow: Oil and Gas Projects Are Back in a Big Way
description: Alaska’s controversial Willow project has drawn criticism, but a global analysis shows that it’s just one of hundreds of investments approved in the past year or so.

title: 2 Generals Took Over a Country. Will They Deliver Democracy or War?
description: The deadline is approaching for the generals who took power in a military coup in Sudan to turn over their authority to a civilian government. The mood in the capital, Khartoum, is anxious.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The reaction to criminal charges against Donald Trump.

title: Keeping an Old Italian Tradition Alive in Australia: ‘Passata Day’
description: Two sisters are among the dwindling few who gather family and friends once a year to make a 12-month supply of tomato passata, a purée that is a staple of Italian cuisine.

title: Russia Accused of Spreading Disinformation at U.N. Security Council
description: Moscow used its rotating presidency of the Security Council to host a session on deported Ukrainian children, leading some officials to walk out.
